author: bynita28
title: appointment system
body:
My appointment with the gp was 1. 5hr late and I rang and checked if my appointment was still valid and was told yes. Prior to this I made another appointment due to the lateness.  
In the end 2 GPs called within minutes of each other and the call felt very rushed. I am owed my time regardless of the gp was running late.  
When I voiced I was unsure of a self testing service which was conducted a few months ago via a nurse. I was told that it how it is always done as it is more effective. I expressed I was not comfortable with it. I was not given any other options.  
I left the appointment feeling tearful and it made me feel unlistened to, " this is why I don't feel comfortable going to the gp" I don't feel listened to. I think the gp sensed this as they did call back to say they had left instructions on how to do the self testing kit at reception which did not comfort my anxiety.

author: Ever-hopeful
title: Staff training for LVAD dressings
body:
First let me say that the care from individual nurses was as always of the very highest standard and I am grateful for that.  
I have an LVAD (Left Ventricular Assist Device) implanted. A week ago I was admitted to 5D via casualty with a suspected thrombus in the pump. During my stay in 5D the dressing, on the site where the driveline from the external control/power enters my abdomen, needed changed. This happens every 3 days. This is an important part of infection control. Infection being a significant risk to LVAD patients.  
On discussing this with the nurse in charge I was told that it would not be possible to change it, as they had not been trained. This despite the fact that there are a number of LVAD patients in Northern Ireland all managed by the Royal Hospital.  
Under normal circumstances this dressing is replaced by my wife. The nurse asked could my wife come to the hospital and change the dressing? She did.  
This leads to some questions.  
1. Why has training not been provided given the number of LVAD patients there are, and the fact that this number will only increase?  
2. What would have happened if my wife had not been available, couldn't travel or indeed was self-isolating?  
3. Given that visits to patients are currently restricted to once a week, is the fact that my wife would have had to come in twice a week an increased risk to herself, patients and staff in relation to Covid-19? I should note I was transferred to the Freeman Hospital and this did not occur on this occasion. What happens the next time?  
I have to be honest, I was surprised that the leading cardiology unit in Northern Ireland was in this situation.  
I have some reservations about these comments in that I was probably the only LVAD patient in recently, and therefore could be easily identified. In addition, I again want to emphasise that otherwise care was of the expected high standard.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: cheetahks77
title: All staff very cheerful
body: This hospital is a credit to the NHS. The care I, a very scared pensioner received could not have been better. I was in ward 3e of the stroke unit, the staff made me feel I was among friends. our ward was spotless, warm and very comfortable. Both nurses, doctors and porters were very cheerful and I felt all my anxiety quickly disperse. once again can I say Thank you to the stroke unit staff, you are all a credit to your profession.

author: vegayx37
title: impressed by efficiency and kindness
body: I have been particularly impressed by the efficiency and kindness during my stay in hospital at BGH and by the visiting occupational therapy team who assisted me after my discharge including Frances and Fiona who arrange for me to have fixed assist handles and equipment. This was done very promptly which has helped me to get mobile again.

author: likeablerr35
title: My Hospital admission
body: Although I attended during the night the ward staff were caring and professional. The day doctor seen me in the morning and gave a thorough assessment. Day staff were supportive and passionate about their jobs. Good rapport among all staff who were in this area.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: februaryjp44
title: Hospital @ home
body:
Very recently i experienced the service of Midlothian Hospital at Home service arranged by my local GP. following removal of my gall bladder in late December I was admitted to Edinburgh Royal at the end of that month with chronic necrotic pancreatitis. There is no known cure for this but here I'am mid April still hoping that things will change. I'am now at home and due to a change in my health recently was offered through my GP the services of HHS. I had three separate visits from nurses Nancy and Jennifer and a telephone call from DR Boyce during which my case was fully discussed in regard to the reason for the visit. The result was a change in medication the effects of which are yet to be analysed after 4 weeks. Both nurses were very friendly caring and extremely efficient. They each understood my case and undertook appropriate tests, made all the more difficult for them under the constraints of the PPE required under the pandemic rules.  
The doctor fully discussed with me my condition and arranged for a new approach having regard to the health issues prevailing at the time.I have since been formally discharged from HHS care and handed back to my GP.  
I have nothing but admiration for the interest and dedication shown to me by these professionals during their short time with me and it certainly has given me a re-assurance to continue with a positive outlook -all is not necessarily lost. It also has given support to the equally wonderful efforts of my GP Dr Downey who has cared for me since the outset of leaving Edinburgh Royal and continues to do so.

author: leathergt69
title: My accident and recovery
body: I had an accident which resulted in a head injury. I was in hospital for 2 weeks and on returning home was visited by occupational therapist, Ranah. I was visited on a weekly basis during which time Ranah helped me with a phased return to work programme. Ranah was a great help with support and advice on realistic expectations, speed of recovery and appreciating I will experience good and bad days during this time. Thank you for all the tremendous support I have been given, it has made a great difference to my recovery.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: hawkgw68
title: wonderful service
body: Hospital @home is a wonderful service. staff are amazing, so caring and helpful.

author: marchkd33
title: pleasant staff
body: They were attentive and pleasant to be with and were very nice at answering any questions we asked them.

author: irregularitykn75
title: professional and considerate
body: Hospital @home very professional and considerate when tending to my wife. felt comfortable leaving my wife's care in their hand.

author: disinfectanttm89
title: everyone showed kindness and professionalism
body: while in the stroke ward the treatment was excellent from the domestic staff right through to nurses, doctors and physio staff. Don't see room for much improvement on the care given by staff. kindness and professionalism in health care was excellent.

author: lynxqc94
title: my hospital visit
body: Everything was as expected considering current situation with covid. food better than expected. no complaints what so ever.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: julyxq55
title: expected to be sent home
body: arrived on a Saturday morning and fully expected to be examined and sent home, but I was admitted to the ward. staff introduced me to the patients. everybody was very friendly and informed.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: volanshn75
title: excellent care
body: Excellent care, food distribution etc. wards very clean

author: victorwj44
title: fantastic care
body: fantastic care. staff are superb.

author: telescopiumqn56
title: exemplary care
body: The care I have received from every person has been exemplary, from the police who opened up my home to allow access for my family and paramedics to treat my rare blood condition and save my life, to all the staff on the wards. I'am grateful for the dignity and kindness shown especially as I had been laying on the floor for 3 days in my own bodily fluids, so not a nice scene to behold for any first responder. the NHS  staff including the domestic staff were lovely. They were professional, courteous, polite and helpful.

author: carinanz63
title: overall experience was good
body: My experience has been good all staff very helpful, polite and caring. food was good. overall experience was good.

author: CYP
title: Pneumonia
body: As an ex PSA employee, I was really scared when I found myself extremely poorly and had to use the hospital. Upon arrival I was seen promptly by lovely staff, however, it was very busy and I had to sit in a chair for 13 hours waiting to go to a ward because there was no bed available. It was torture, an experience I will never forget. I fully understand the bed situation, but now upon reflection a trolley in the corridor would have been far better, especially given the amount of time waiting. I was eventually taken to AMU A and can honestly say the staff on that ward are exceptional, the care I received was second to none, I can't praise them enough, thank you to all the staff, the HCAs, nurses, doctors, everybody.

links.id: cellulitis on leg due to reaction to antibiotics

author: cetuscp77
title: Mixed experiences in Hospital
body:
I had mixed experiences in Hospital.  
On the whole I liked many of the staff and thought they had a difficult job.  
I valued the services offered by OT assistant and healthcare assistants eg taking patients out.  
I did not like the restrictions on my liberty and being watched during the night.  
I also did not like alterations to the garden and the erection of a high wall more suited to a prison

author: mcl87
title: Difficulties with the appointment system
body:
I am writing to highlight the difficulties with the appointment system at Lanark Gp practice, Woodstock medical centre. I am aware of the problems with this over the years with and how it has been an ongoing issue but after all this time there is still no solution.  
I am a full time worker and the appointment system currently in place gives me no scope to phone into the surgery between the allocated time frame of 8-10am. I am unable to call from work due to my profession as I work within the hospital setting and cannot take lengthy breaks to enable me to call. I have been able to work round this previously when the afternoon triage line was also available. I understand the reason this was implemented as it’s less wasted appointments and works well to an extent. The frustration I have is with non urgent concerns or minor issues that need treated.  
I am aware that any urgent concerns I wouldn’t be fit for work and therefore could phone the practice easily. I have a long term health condition which I rely on my Gp practice at times to assist with minor problems due to this. I have occasionally phoned out with the time frame and been told by reception staff that they are unable to help and I need to call back within the allocated time. This is no fault of theirs I know, but it is so very frustrating and often not helped by staff attitude towards the situation.  
I would like to know if the practice are any further forward with a better approach to their appointment system and how patients should go about non urgent concerns that require Gp/ANP input.  
I want to also state that this feedback isn’t purely negative, there has been many occasions where I have found the practice to be efficient and helpful but since taking the PM triage service away and there being no option to book appointments in advance I have recently felt frustrated with the ongoing issue.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: pnh1967
title: Repeat prescriptions and increased anxiety
body:
I have been taking consultant prescribed medication for a number of years, since this at one time ensured that you were not getting generic medication, and that my GP surgery could not stop me getting the correct repeat medication.  
This problem has been going on since 1996, but over the years it is just how the practice operates. In the past few years my sleeping medication has been stopped several times, and the excuse is a review, yet my records show in writing letters from a consultant stating dosage etc. I feel I have been pushed into attending a CBT courses, on pain of stopping sleeping meds. I feel this is lip service from the practice to patients around mental health  
Am anxious and scared for days before and after a prescription is submitted, especially since the practice does not keep seem to keep accurate records of my prescriptions. Much worse having to contact them by phone as constantly engaged, and anxiety levels massive when they call back.

author: In it together
title: Feeling safe and cared for
body:
I recently attended North Parade GP practice, just off the Ormeau Road Belfast, for a series of tests.  
My experience was first class from start to finish. Firstly I called the practice and the team discussed my issue to identify how best to help me. A GP rang me within a short time and arranged for tests to be carried out later that week. I was given very clear instructions about how to access the surgery given the COVID situation which I followed.  
I attended the surgery which was so well organised in terms of protecting the patients attending. This included patients not meeting each other in the corridor, ongoing cleaning and socially distanced seating. I had an appointment with the practice nurse then the GP immediately after. Everyone in the practice was so friendly, helpful and kind. I felt listened to, cared for and most importantly safe. I want my sincerest thanks to be shared with the practice thank you.

author: Trejoco
title: Skin Cancer
body:
Having had a Renal Transplant 24 years ago I feel blessed however I always knew with my drug regime I was suseptable to skin cancer. I developed a small blister on my right ear and was referred to the Maxcillo facial clinic at Lincoln hospital. The consultant confirmed it was skin cancer and that they would cut out the blister and pull the skin over...I would never know I had had it done.  
During the course of the next 18 months my notes were lost at least twice, my surgical referral was lost,2 junior doctors completely discharged me by accident. During this time telephone contact was impossible as by their own admittance when it got busy they turned the phones off.  
Eventually after 18 months a rather shocked surgeon removed half my ear. When I returned 2 months later for what I thought would be the promised reconstruction surgery I was told they had not removed all the cancer and I needed another operation to remove more of my ear.  
A month ago I got a call from The Pilgrim Hospital Boston who are now handling my case to say the telephone consultation could not go ahead as they could not find my notes!  
This week I had a telephone consultation from doctor at Boston telling me no reconstruction and my case was being signed off.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Oban123
title: Oban midwives
body:
I really want to sing the praises of Oban maternity unit midwives and staff.  
This was my second pregnancy. After my first birth being complicated, I was anxious about the birth of my second baby.  
From the very beginning Elayne (my named midwife) made me feel supported, cared for and listened to. This was important to me and enabled me to feel confident and at ease throughout my pregnancy. I must add that any complications that arose throughout my pregnancy, Elayne gave me lots of reassurance and respected decisions that I made.  
Elayne reassured me that she do her very best to be there for my labour and she was. This made a huge difference having someone with me that I was familiar with and felt comfortable with. Her professionalism, friendliness and calmness immediately made me feel at ease during the labour. Hannah was also there and together her and Elayne made sure I was as relaxed as possible. Together they complemented each other during my time in the unit. I really couldn’t have asked for two better midwives at my labour, an experience that will stay with me for the rest of my life. They both gave me the greatest gift I could ask for - my baby and a positive birthing experience- thank you

title: Amazing
body: Very impressed with the service received from the timeframe, to the friendliness and professionalism of all the staff, especially in these hard times.  Thank you and keep up the amazing work

title: Great practice
body: The staff were welcoming and organised. I was seen quickly with no issues. I felt at calm and at ease. I felt that the staff were professional and had everything under control.

title: Wonderful Friendly Service
body:
Checked in and went through temperature check and then on to triage nurse who was very friendly and wanted to get me seen quickly. Going up to first floor, this area needs signs or a receptionist who can send people to the right area, sent me right instead of left and I had wait for ten minutes when they were waiting for me. Quickly seen by doctor for initial assessment and then sent for blood test and then to last slot for ultrasound. Aster this a long wait for a final visit to a doctor as I am not an urgent case. He was a scream, and I know that my situation caused some concern, as not a straight forward case. Then seen by senior doctor and finally away after 4 hours which I had allocated anyway. At every stage the staff gave their name or had a badge clearly showing their name, and were friendly. I was surprised how empty the waiting area was on arrival at 2.30 pm and the effort to get me seen quickly was appreciated. Quickly moved from staff to staff, and each stage the process was explained. The waiting area on first floor whilst marked out for social distancing leaves little space for waiting and some people had to stand. I learned a lot from the doctor who gave me some very interesting facts about previous problems which could have caused the present problem and he was happy to get a second opinion which gave me some useful information.
As I had the last ultrasound appointment at 3.30 pm what happens to patients coming in later - surely this service should be available 24 hours?
The only person to offer any criticism was when i came in through the entrance and the person handling this asked me to adjust my mask which I had lowered as they could not understand what I said. Do you need two people at the entrance to check peopleout?

title: Thank You!
body: Just needed to say …..     thank you to the entire team at KMP for the most efficient management and expeditious organisation of administering the flu jabs. I attended for my jab yesterday and was amazed at how well the system was controlled – I was ‘in and out’ in minutes (probably two minutes) but then I wouldn’t expect anything less from this astounding medical practice.  Well Done Team KMP, and Thank You!

title: Prompt in dealing with medial problems.
body:
Recently, I made a telephone appointment with one of the doctors on the permanent nominal roll. I was phoned on the dot and answered my query very clearly. I needed a a vaccine that is not given on a regular basis. However, as a precautionary measure, I decided to ask for it. 
The doctor referred  my notes and immediately  authorised it.  A senior nurse phoned me that evening and gave an appointment for next day in the morning. She was ready to see me that day itself and it was my choice to see her the next day.
This nurse has a very friendly way and she gives enough time to the patient. The patient should know not to abuse the opportunity!!. Well there were no side effects at all.  I have being with the surgery for 26 years and have witnessed the changes.  I have noticed a nice change during the last 5 - 7 years. 
It took a fair amount of thinking  for me to pen down these details. It is a  pity that I cannot mention the names of the doctor   and  the nurse  who dealt with my case.

title: Marvellous staff and treatment
body: I've only just come across these review pages. In Sept 2019 I was admitted to Bristol Heart Institute with a heart attack. Every aspect of my treatment was marvellous. The staff show great skill and empathy, the treatments, including putting in a stent, were first class, and the accommodation was very good. I owe a deep debt of gratitude to BHI.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Bristol and Weston NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fast service
body: Attended A&E with a foot injury. The service was fast and efficient. All staff friendly and helpful.

title: Excellent Service
body: I had a cycling accident this week and I was fortunate enough to be very close to the clinic . I was booked in efficiently and within minutes the paramedic on duty attended to my serious injury. The experience was wonderful and the communication great. I was referred to A&E at St Richards where  the service was equally as professional. I would like to thank you so much for your attention to detail and attending to my needs - well done NHS

title: Nurse was great
body: I'm terrible with needles and needed a blood test, the nurse was amazing, she laid me down and kept me talking throughout the whole thing, kept me distracted, it was over in no time

title: Fabulous practice
body: The doctors, nurses and staff are always only too happy to help and treat you with the utmost respect and dignity at all times. I've recently been through a very difficult time and one of the doctor's has been extremely supportive and helped me through every step of the way on my long and arduous journey to recovery.  I cannot thank them enough and will be forever grateful.

title: Horrendous booking and phone system
body: It is such a shame that Winterton Medical Practice use such an old fashioned booking system as all of the staff I have seen at the practice are lovely and helpful. If you manage to get through on the phone, after trying to use an automated booking system that doesn’t work, you’ll be lucky! It seems like such a simple fix to upgrade the phones and booking system and would make such a big difference to patients, and probably the reception staff too, if only they’d do it. I wouldn’t recommend the practice and would register elsewhere if there was somewhere else in the village to go!

title: Caring Culture
body: Promptly taken into Ipswich A&E from ambulance having reported chest pains , staff were quick to re-assure and initiate tests , handling me with care and consideration. I was monitored and told about the progress. At intervals of about ten minutes staff took further readings and also gave me a thorough examination. Finally I was told the results and advised as to my future health. I rated my treatment very highly -very professional and caring. I was also impressed by ancillary staff, one turned the lights down to spare my eyes and another helped me call a taxi- evidence to me of a spendid"caring culture"

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: COVID CONCERNS
body:
I attended the branch surgery on Monday 12 October for a pre planned appointment and was told I would be triaged with regard to potential COVID symptoms.  I was not.  Given the current clime, this was , I consider, a major oversight by the staff.
Other patients and I felt we were nuisances for being there.  This is not the service we usually receive from the surgery and I, personally, found this very disappointing and discerning.

title: No one to talk to
body: I called at 8.30 to hear a recorded message saying no appointments left today!!!! Called emergency number and the phone is switched off. Feeling very sad and low.

title: Shockingly poor customer service
body: Interaction with the practice by telephone, the only one possible during the Coronavirus pandemic, is frustrating and irritating. Getting to speak a human takes at the very least 5 minutes (make sure if you have enough credit on your mobile phone!). When you actually get speak to an operator, you wish you had spoken to a computer. The receptionists' attitude is cold, patronising and insensitive. Booking a telephone appointment requires stamina and discipline. When you actually get one, the GP may call at a different time from the one agreed. If you miss the call and ring the practice immediately, they tell you to call tomorrow and book again. Speaking to the management doesn't seem to solve problems. It sounds like the receptionists are trained to create unnecessary barriers and make patients' life harder than it already is. However, in the rare occasion you do get to a doctor, they are indeed very helpful, competent and understanding.

author: Lours
title: Appointment
body:
I was a inpatient after a op was sent home to wait for my next appointment, I was not told what it would involve, after many weeks of waiting and in pain I got the letter through. It did not state they were planning doing a procedure that day.  
I turned up to be told they were planning it that day. Due to how much pain I’m in I told them I needed to know beforehand so I could have brought painkillers as I have a 30 min journey home. So now I’m not back on the list which I was told it will be a long wait as there is a list of 2000 patients to go through.  
I explained how much pain I’m in and how it’s effecting my life. All this could have been prevented if they told me exactly what they were planning. And no idea when I will next be seen. The lack of care is hideous. So now I’m left again waiting in limbo in horrendous pain.  
Never ever experienced a hospital to be like this ever. I feel very let down at all of this. It’s unacceptable

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

title: Awful experience with very rude receptionist
body:
I visited the practice yesterday 14th October in the morning around 10am. I had stitches removed from my foot with a lovely caring nurse that told me to report to reception that I need it a sick note and had the flu jab. The receptionist who I haven’t seen before couldn’t be bothered with me, she clearly didn’t want me there. Taking to me like I was inferior, I never felt this small and so insulted before this experience. She kept repeating the same to me like I couldn’t understand her the first time and dismissing me, talking in a very rude and aggressive way. I was so shocked I forgot half of what the nurse told me to report to reception. I rang the bell to come back in to tell her what I forgot she again was very rude and clearly didn’t want to open the door to me but eventually did, again she was was so rude that I left there shaking and actually told her she was a very rude person before I left.
No matter what we all going through there is no need to treat people this way, respect and kindness are free and in this type of jobs even more important. I have worked with customer service all my life and never encounter such a shocking behaviour.
Lidia Gaspar

title: Awful receptionist
body: The receptionist was very rude on the phone and she has no respect for patients at all. She told me that the doctor can’t keep calling you if you don’t answer your call once. She mentioned she won’t book me in if I don’t answer it again even though I mentioned to her why I couldn’t answer and that she didn’t give me a specific appointment time.  Very bad service and just not happy.

title: Improve website and answerphone greeting
body:
The practice feels very safe for face-to-face visits, with good controls to reduce infection during the pandemic. Online queries are dealt with relatively promptly. 

However the phone message received when phoning the practice commences with a doctor stating that you must (with emphasis on this word) contact the practice online, presumably a message recorded at the height of the pandemic. If you hold, you do get through to reception but that initial phrase can be very disconcerting for anyone without access to the internet or who is not IT literate and might well make them end the call. Rephrasing this as a request but then saying to hold for an operator where needed would be more encouraging to patients, particularly those in an anxious or emotional state because of illness.

The website in its new form has no information about staff, either in words or pictures. In an age of medical concern and when people look for transparency, this does not inspire confidence when it is not known who the practice staff are. A small photo, brief biography and role in the organisation would be very welcome. Other public services do this and it would be good for the practice and its patients to include this information on the website.

author: Mcquade365
title: My dad's flu vaccination
body:
I attended Udston hospital with my dad for his flu vaccination in October 2020. My dad has significant issues with his mobility and was required to walk to the Douglas ward from the main entrance. This was a struggle but we managed.  
However, I can't thank the staff enough, particularly a nurse called Emma who recognised my concern and the level of restriction my dad presented with. She was able to get us a wheelchair to get him back to the car. I would like to thank the staff at Udston immunisation team for the brief but considered care they gave father. Perhaps wheelchairs could be put at the entrance for others who have mobility problems

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Professional and efficient practice
body:
I had a cataract procedure at this clinic.

From arrival to discharge, I was impressed by the care I was given and the efficiency of all the staff and clinicians involved.

Highly recommended

title: Professional and  efficient
body: Very impressed how efficient the staff team organised the flu jab this year. Impressed no waiting around in and out quickly

author: Scotguy37
title: Visit to Minor Injuries department
body: I was taken quickly (by hospital standards) and treated very well by Nurse Gaynor. I was warmly welcomed, examined with care and quickly diagnosed after a prompt x-ray. The advice and treatment was clear and concise and what I would expect from NHS Scotland. Great service with fantastic staff on the front line... They should be paid more and treated with way more respect than they are by the UK government and the media in my opinion. I hope I don't have to visit minor injuries again but if I do, I fully trust I'll be in capable and caring hands.

author: CSween
title: Completely skilful in what they were doing
body:
Went in today to A and E and from the receptionist, triage nurse, Dr and consultant I saw - every one of them was friendly, caring and quite honestly superb.  
Our Drs and Nurses do an incredible job under, often, very difficult circumstances.  
A huge thank you to the Dr and Consultant in A and E tonight. can not recall blonde female Dr name but consultant I think was Kate. She had to use an ultrasound just to find my vein for canula for cat scan, I was in my own and concerned and both she and the Dr were completely skilful in what they were doing. Thank you for what you did and what you do every day.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Seriously gone downhill
body:
I’ve been with the surgery 15 years and it used to be the best surgery in Clacton now it’s down with the worst. Trying to get an appointment with the doctor is ridiculous the receptionists think they know best and try to redirect you to anywhere but the surgery, including the pharmacy, specs savers. No matter how many times you insist you need an appointment they’re not interested. When you do keep on insisting you may be lucky to see a nurse.
Also if you’re in the middle of treatment you need to keep on following up because they forget things like blood tests, I even booked a telephone appointment and this was totally forgotten and I had to telephone the next day and ask why nobody called me.
Another thing they’ve started doing rather than calling you sending you a text and asking you to call them which clogs up the phone lines and means that nobody can ever get through.
I try not to use any of the services unless it’s really important I sit here ill because I can’t be bothered to go through all the performance of trying to get an appointment with someone and having to tell the receptionist my personal situation. It’s such a shame as the surgery used to be very good but I struggle every time I have to use any of the services. I’ve also been told by the surgery before if you don’t like it maybe you could find somewhere that’s more suited to you. Why should I have to find somewhere when all I’m asking for is a professional competent service by my nearest healthcare facility.

title: Awful reception staff
body: There have been times I have been left in tears after speaking to the reception staff at the practice. Most are utterly rude, rush you when you are on the phone and have no patience what so ever.  I really think the practice should look in to their recruitment process. Most of the doctors are lovely, the reception staff really let the practice down. I have lost track of how many examples i can give as to how I have been treated poorly by the staff. I have been registered at the practice for over 20 years and it has really gone down hill over the past few years.

title: Excellent practice
body:
Appointment made for flu jab via telephone with instructions on procedure 
On arrival to surgery. Appointment on time and procedure complete with no problems.

title: Five stars
body: Thank you for your professional care, support, throughout my treatment you were all amazing.  The clinic was bright clean and all Covid regulations were in place before arrival and carried out thoroughly to prevent any problems. Thank you once again and I highly recommend your clinic.

title: Great practice
body: Always great service provided by the doctors. They work hard and always give appropriate advise. If u want quality service this is where to go.

title: Private Medical Report Administrator
body:
I have recently been speaking to the Private Medical Report Administrator regarding a few questions from my medical history.

She is a assert to the team, she is quick and efficient in answering any of my questions and put my mind at ease. I would recommend this surgery and the Private Medical Report Administrator to anyone.

Thank you for all your help.

title: Rude, uncaring receptionist staff
body:
Of all sectors , you’d expect those working in healthcare no matter their roles to be polite and welcoming as it is these people we go to when we are most in need but today I was faced with a very rude member of receptionist who hung up on me over a small misunderstanding and told me not to call again despite my concerns for my health. 

Due to the virus I had requested a call back from the surgery via my online portal for a health problem and missed their call and was instructed to call back and rearrange a call if missed  and as I tried to explain this to her as well as  my reason for calling she was extremely rude and proceeded to hang up the phone. 

This has been my first human contact of the day and to be honest has ruined the start of my  day and Increased my anxieties about my health issue as it seems no one cares! 

I do not advise anyone to sign up with DMU SURGERY especially students , despite the ‘convenience’ of it being on campus you are better off looking else where.

title: Efficient and caring practice staff
body: Got through on the phone after only a couple of tries , receptionist had a nice friendly manner. GP callback was within the am/pm time slot. Found the GP to be very helpful and supportive, clearly listened to my concerns and made a logical plan.

title: Excellent service
body:
I waited a while to get through but my call was answered by a very pleasant & helpful Receptionist who booked me in for a flu jab & also resolved a prescription enquiry which saved me booking a GP call back request & running out of my medication.
Much appreciated!
Thank you City Way Surgery

title: Excellent service
body:
I waited a while to get through but a very helpful & pleasant Receptionist booked my fly jab & resolved a prescription query which meant that I did not need to book a GP call book & did not run out of my medication.
Much appreciated
Thank you City way surgery

author: Jjjc
title: Icd
body: My mother has an icd and twice her appointment has now been moved.   She has not been seen at clinic now for a year and has now been informed that it will be another year before being seen.   She had a cardiac arrest at home before her  icd was put in and has been told she has heart failure. She has always been told she needs regular follow ups at clinics because of this so how can it all be OK she now has to waits 2 years to be seen. I phoned the clinic to be reassured that it was all fine  . But how can you tell if she has had not had her regular follow-up appointments done ...    worried family

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Thank you NHS
body: People at the GP have been very caring during this current crisis and myself and the public are very grateful for their dedication I hope the government reward you guys honestly

title: Disappointment
body: Can’t ever get through, it’s been days.. goes straight to busy without even ringing and then cuts off. When I have been able to get though in the past, I’ve had to wait 15-20 minutes on hold if not longer. Generally doctors have been good but the process to get to see them or speak to them is appalling! I like Penkridge but if I was to start a family here with my partner, I’d feel like I’d have to move to get a better service. I don’t think this is fair. I hope this gets better soon.

author: BigMerk
title: My dad’s excellent care in Ward 3A
body:
My dad is 85 years old and has some recently-diagnosed underlying health issues which probably contributed to a fall at home in September 2020. Unfortunately he broke his hip. The emergency services were very good, especially in these difficult times with the virus straining resources. His experience in Queen Elisabeth University Hospital, where he was operated upon, wasn’t great mainly thru severe post-op delirium and the fact that no-one was allowed to visit (which caused him real anxiety). After a week he was moved to Gartnavel Hospital to recuperate and things started to improve immediately.  
From the start at Gartnavel the communication from the ward - 3A - was excellent. They recognised immediately that my dad needed some contact with the family and, as the oldest son and Power of Attorney, I was the designated visitor. From stories told by my dad as well as my own experience on visits over 10 days, I cannot speak highly enough of the staff on the ward. Each time I visited there was a friendly greeting as I checked-in, followed by a detailed update on my dads progress. It was excellent.  
My dad reported that the attention from the nursing staff was first class and he really enjoyed the quality and quantity of food. Throughout I had a direct phone line to the ward should I need to contact them. The staff were very hard-working and deserve great credit for dealing so well with so many older people who often create great challenges.  
I was well-briefed by the staff on discharge too which was very helpful and put our minds at rest during a stressful time.  
Well done to all involved. This feels like a TripAdviser review - all I can say is that I wouldn’t wish a hospital stay on anyone, but if you had to, then ward 3A at Gartnavel would be an excellent place to go.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Reliable practice
body:
Although current restrictions can make booking appointments a bit tedious (long hold times etc) my overall recent experience has been positive. I attended to get my daughters nasal flu vaccination and they were friendly and kind making the experience a little less daunting for my 2 year old. They even did my vaccination at the same time so I wouldn’t have to come back the following day when my original appointment had been booked. 

I have always been able to get appointments at this practice with minimal inconvenience and they understand my medical background well.

title: Drive through flu jabs organised by Boroughbury
body: Just been down to Posh for our annual flu jab, this time without having to leave the car. We got a text prompt to book, but no text confirmation which they seemed to expect but it wasn’t a problem. There could have been signage from the bridge southern roundabout but we found it easily enough. A good idea in the present situation. Looking forward to having our anti Covid vaccine!

title: Practice review
body: The doctor was very accommodating and dealt with my queries and concerns. The online booking of appointments should however be clearer

title: Flu clinic
body: Very efficient: safeguarding measures in place, called in exactly on time, put at ease by friendly nursing staff - all in all a positive experience.

title: A very positive experience.
body: I visited the department this morning regarding a small lesion on my tongue. It was a positive and professional experience thank you.

title: Great GO surgery
body: I joined this GP in September 2020 following the birth of my first child. In the short time I have been at the surgery I’ve had to visit lots of times for both baby and me. I have found it easy to make appointments (phone due to CVOID and in person when needed) and found the care to be excellent. I would recommend this surgery - best I have had in London.

title: Superb treatment
body:
I had an endoscopy in Evesham Community Hospital.  I found the staff to be exceptionally friendly, gentle and informative.  They collectively made the whole procedure much less stressful for me and made me feel I was important.  I was not hurried in any way and time was taken to explain everything to me, before and after the procedure.
Thank you very much staff.

title: Very helpful
body: I attended the practise for my flu  injection.  I was a bit apprehensive before the appointment but  I was put at ease as soon as I  arrived  as everything was well organised to keep you safe.  All the staff  all reassuring.

title: Good service
body: I am very happy with the service offered and the staff here will help you with the query and deal with it till the end.

title: Fantastic care
body:
Every time I've had contact with the surgery be it receptionists, doctors or nurses the quality of care I've received has been exceptional.
There is a friendly, professional air at this surgery that makes it a comfortable and safe environment. No question is to "silly". You are treated as an individual with your concerns acknowledged, addressed and sorted. Easily 5/5* for these hard working, friendly people.

title: great front desk customer service
body:
I was very pleased with the warm and inviting customer service I received this morning whiles visiting Moorefield eye hospital from the front desk team. I was also pleased with swift and prompt way in which my case was dealt with.
 However I feel from my experience, security offer and nurse on door duty could be more inclusive and less intimidating suspicious and passive aggressive, we understand the United Kingdom is facing tough times, but I did not see fair and unbiased customer service from Moorefield security team.

title: Extremely preferable surgery for patients
body:
Staff of surgery is very helpful and cooperative, I would say they value human lives and take care of every one. The reception staff and doctors all are very nice and professional. I would like to say thank you to their male reception staff and manager to sort out my sister wheel chair long awaited request in Camden.
Thank you 
surgery

title: efficient flu jab system
body: Really well organised flu vaccination day - in and out within a few minutes, lots of staff on hand, felt very covid safe...great!

title: Very happy with my GP practice
body: I had an appointment with the Health Care Assistant and could not be happier with my experience. The assistant was so considerate, professional and helpful, explaining everything to me carefully so I knew what was happening. Everything was thoroughly cleaned and great care taken, so I felt very safe.

title: Compassionate doctors
body: For the past month or so I have had glandular fever and was particularly ill, in a lot of pain and generally upset by the situation. Two Doctors who I have emailed my surgery about treated me with such kindness, compassion and patience (I was unable to speak so attempted to communicate in other ways). Their care was truly appreciated and they went above and beyond to help me.

title: Lovely staff
body: I came for camera down ,believed called TEO. The two doctors and nurse were brilliant, kind and caring. I felt safe, this department staff  are a credit to the NGH. From the reception when we came in to going home, Thankyou everyone...please pass this on💙.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: very satisfied
body: We are new patients at the practice and very satisfied with service provided from the practice - admin lead went out of her way to resolve our issues.

title: The best practice ever
body:
I have always received excellent patient care from 3 of the doctors at this practice. My doctor is the main one I would like to thank sincerely from my heart, as they have always responded to my calls especially when my anxiety gets the better of me and I feel out of place. My doctor hears me out and helps me accordingly, which I appreciate as I feel a lot better with taking my medicine. The only way I can describe how much I appreciate the doctors and staff at this practice is that I am not leaving from small heath area because I will have to change my g.p practice. Which I had to do, when I relocated couple of years ago but came back here because there is no other doctors like my doctor, at this practice. I wish I can mention their name but I understand it will be removed. However I hope all the doctors and staff know that they are sincerely appreciated by patients like me and I apologise for the ones that are to grumpy to say a nice thing or two.

I wish everyone well, stay healthy and safe.

author: Annoyedguy
title: Flu vaccine
body: Due to being made to self isolate by track & trace app I have missed my chance for flu vaccine in my area. I phoned both gp & the number on the flu vaccine Letter to ask if could do it elsewhere & was no help. If isolating is 14 days and between the first & last flu vaccine is 8 days how are people self isolating to help the NHS meant to get a flu vaccine

author: Happy senior
title: My experience with a hand operation
body:
From the moment I walked in the door until the time I left the unit I could not have been in better hands. The nursing staff, the anaesthetist and surgeons could not have been more caring and attentive. The whole procedure went very smoothly with every detail being explained to me as the day went on.  
I was well looked after so a big thanks to the whole team.

author: MrsRobinson
title: The stroke unit
body:
What a terrible experience we had while my father was on the stroke unit. While the general nursing staff were fantastic. Senior level staff were appalling. From the first moment dad was admitted, i was met by a doctor. This doctor told me that my dad had had a massive stroke, and although they did have the ability to have removed the clot and massive improve his outcome......they don't do it on Saturdays. This information was delivered with a shrug and smile. This attitude continued through out the whole of his care.  
Ridiculously unprofessional, i was told by one member of staff that another had no idea what they were doing. I learnt of derogatory nicknames used among staff. As relatives, we were met with a wall of silence to any enquiries and during visiting times were made to feel uncomfortable and unwanted.  
What a disgrace.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Melrd85
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff member
body: The support I have received from Ray has been overwhelming. I have been waiting to hear about detox/rehab, I am now sticking to my script and I don't want to use any more.

author: Elmwood
title: Wonderful Treatment
body:
I cannot speak highly enough of the treatment I received from Croydon University hospital in the early hours of Sunday.  
I woke up about 1am with significant pain in my stomach and after an hour or so, I was in absolute agony. My wife then called 111 and an ambulance was sent out and they administered morphine, before taking me to your hospital arriving probably around 4.30am.  
Over the next few hours, I was given a chest x-ray, stomach x-ray, an ECG, a CT scan, an ultrasound scan, a covid test, had my bloods done and had been examined by at least three doctors.  
By approximately 9.30 that morning, I was visited by the on duty Urology Consultant who advised me that I had a small kidney stone, which she thought I would probably pass over the next few days and sent me home with some pain killers. This proved to be absolutely correct and I passed it the following evening.  
At every stage, every member of staff I came into contact was absolutely wonderful to me and I cannot thank them enough for their efforts.

author: Nts
title: Exceptional Service from entry to exit
body:
From entry to exit, I cannot find fault with anything. The service from your staff was exceptional, your food excellent, and the overall experience was a special memory to be remembered long after my operation is forgotten.  
I thank all your staff for the care and treatment I received during my stay in the cardiology ward.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: ItWasMe
title: Deaf person - Contact
body:
Well done to Molly from the appointments office, who marked my file for email contact with a pop up feature that alerts staff of why email is needed.Phone calls are just not an option... makes life easier for me and the staff who are trying to contact me.  
Cant use sign language unfortunatelyWell done Molly

author: Double TKR
title: The Welcome, Kindness and Care
body:
What worked well... All the staff are amazing!! It is my second visit in 10 weeks and I cannot say enough about the welcome, kindness and Care that I have been given. Nothing has been too much bother and the positive attitudes are amazing even though everybody is so busy.  
We can be done to improve the experience....  
Keep the same porter taking patients down and back for test and xrays. I didn’t have to sit in a corridor this time. It was a lovely change from last time.  
Thank you all, your time and kindness is very much appreciated especially Kerry and Karen my named nurses. Then there was Kathy who really got me sorted both times I stayed and I can’t thank her enough.

author: Transparency advocate
title: Diagnosis discrimination and abdication of duty of care
body:
My husband had a covid positive swab in September 2020 he gradually began to deteriorate at home mainly with dehydration initially. I have his full consent to tell our story on CO.  
Our GP practice (Westbourne Medical Center, Bournemouth refused a telephone consultation and sent a message via the receptionist to say phone 111 they are the experts. We have raised a complaint with the practice manager however wanted transparency in sharing our story for other service users. We cannot begin to imagine what it would be like for other families who do not have a family member with medical knowledge trying to access help for a sick person and being inappropriately sign posted via a receptionist.  
In this climate of the pandemic uncertainty and anxiety we all accept services are limited with little or no face to face contact with our GP’s. The very least we can expect is a telephone consultation with a prescribing professional in order to discuss and manage symptoms and work towards prevention of hospital admissions, regardless of diagnosis. Our practice states on their website around covid, that telephone consultations are available for advice.  
Three days after testing positive, 08:30 am.  
On day 6 of my husbands symptoms (no breathing difficulty) and deterioration, mainly dehydration, dizziness/nausea and acute pyrexia/rigours – I called the surgery to request a telephone consultation.  
I was seeking validation of my concerns from a professional that was not emotionally invested and perhaps try anti emetics to manage nausea and enable him to take fluids. I also wanted to rule out a source of infection, a possible UTI/sepsis.  
The receptionist (who was very professional and polite) asked what was it about. I firstly said he had tested Covid Positive, as an aid for staff to triage any urgency and same day consultation, and briefly outlined my concerns wishing to speak more in depth with a GP/nurse practitioner.  
The receptionist said hold the line and they would go and speak to them, returning to say “They said ring 111 because they are the experts.” I could not believe “they” had said that, I was seeking advice and support re symptoms not Covid advice or testing.  
The receptionist was very apologetic and said they were just relaying the message they had been given.  
I firmly believe “Covid Positive” was the only message heard by “them” whoever they were, and this was the Diagnosis Discrimination and abdication of duty of care by inappropriately sign posting to 111. I may have accepted it if I had the courtesy of a phone consult with a GP and they, after discussion felt it was appropriate to signpost to 111.  
I rang 111, as you know this takes a very long time to get through, I went through the standard Algorithm with the call handler – they spoke to my husband and we were not surprisingly told to phone our GP.  
111 were amazing and took pity on us, apparently GP's signposting to 111 inappropriately is not an uncommon occurrence and a clinician called us back - he spoke to my husband at length about fluid intake.  
The next day.  
I sent an email at 6 am to patient contact requesting a telephone consult with a GP, outlined concerns putting symptoms first and Covid positive almost as a footnote. my husband was deteriorating further and faster.  
12 midday – 30 hours after attempting to initially speak to a GP.  
I received a call from a GP (sorry I didn’t absorb their name at the time) in response to the email request. Although lovely and helpful, they were very concerned and anxious about his symptoms.  
They asked me if I was aware of how serious dehydration was? I recall saying yes, seizures, heart failure, kidney failure and that’s why I phoned the day before and was told to ring 111. This made me feel that I had been the one delaying seeking help.  
I said his symptoms had worsened since then and he was very unwell. This GP spoke briefly to my husband gaining consent to talk to me. They stressed that they would prescribe the anti-emetics but strongly advised I call for a paramedic assessment.  
13.30 following trying anti- emetics I called for a paramedic assessment. He was admitted to hospital.  
Could this have been avoided had we had the courtesy of a phone consult with the GP 30 hours previously? possibly/possibly not as we all know Covid is unpredictable and somewhat a silent assassin.  
There was no follow up call from the GP to ensure I had called for paramedic assessment.  
The paramedic service (south Western Ambulance) was outstanding, after I initially did the 999 call I received a call from a paramedic lead - he was calm, reassuring, we talked through all the symptoms I was concerned about and he validated the concerns and what a plan of care may look like after the crew had assessed.. He did not question whether I knew the consequences of the symptoms.  
The crew that arrived a male and female were equally amazing, calm, measured assessment approach, obviously dressed in full PPE. They showed exceptional skills in managing what is a potentially a highly charged situation, with a wife who hadn't slept for 4 nights giving regular care and a very sick husband not knowing how he would respond in hospital and whether we would see each other again.  
That day My husband was admitted to A4 Arne in Poole Hospital via the A&E assessment area for Covid patients. We are very thank full for the care he received on his Poole Hospital Journey. He said they were prepared, professional, efficient, they kept him informed at all times and provided exceptional care as a team. He was recruited to a Covid Recovery study which not only was he committed to do his bit for society, it also meant that professionals would be monitoring him for 10 years as we cannot rely on even a phone consult from our GP practice.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust
Plymouth University Urgent and Emergency Care Bsc (2020)
South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

author: Busybees
title: Thank you so much for your help and support
body:
I was detained in a psychiatric hospital under the Mental Health Act several weeks ago.  
My first psychiatry meeting was held on the first day I was admitted to hospital.  
In my first psychiatry meeting in hospital, I expected to be seen by a psychiatrist and a nurse alone.  
However, when I walked into the meeting room, I saw eight people sitting in a meeting room waiting for me, including a psychiatrist, a trainee doctor who was responsible to take notes, another trainee doctor, a nurse, another nurse, a student nurse, a pharmacist and a trainee pharmacist (?). I was absolutely overwhelmed to be greeted by so many health care professionals.  
During the meeting, the psychiatrist talked about the reason why I was there, my diagnoses and the treatment plan in details in front of trainee doctors, nurses, and pharmacists. The psychiatrist also asked me to talk about my thoughts in details in front of them, I was extremely unease to talk about self-harm, overdosed and suicidal thought in front of other seven strangers at the time.  
I was very upset and distressed after the meeting, I was like I was not being treated with the dignity and respect I should expect when I was in crisis.  
Days later, Helen who is an Independent Mental Health Advocate (IMHA) of Advocacy Support Cymru (ASC), introduced herself to me on the ward.  
I told Helen I was extremely distressed and traumatized after the first meeting. She listened to my views and concerns, and she explained to me what are my options and rights in a psychiatric hospital. To help me stand up for my rights and speak for me, Helen promised me she could accompany me and support me in my next meeting with the psychiatrist and other health care professionals.  
Helen is brilliant! She is very competent and experienced advocate, and she takes things seriously.  
I find it extremely helpful to have Helen to stand up for my rights and speak for me, particularly in a meeting with a psychiatrist. By doing so, it makes me feel less worried of being misunderstood or having my concerns dismissed by the psychiatrist.  
I highly recommend you to have an advocate to stand up for your rights and speak for you! And please do not miss it when the opportunity arises!  
Thank you Helen, for everything you have done to me 😊.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Keefy
title: My care during recent operation
body:
I was obviously nervous booking into the Sandbourne Suite, to prepare for a gall bladder removal operation. The check in was easy and I was directed to a room where I was welcomed and cared for. Gown, dressing gown supplied and all the forms completed. The anaesthetist came in and carefully explained the procedure answering all my questions . The surgeons representative also chatted and put me at ease... I was then taken to the operating theatre 6. I must say that I have had one full anaesthetic before but I was 19 and long ago not to remember the experience .  
The staff was caring welcoming and so nice. Chatting away and I didn’t feel a thing, a strange event as the next thing I know I was gently being woken up an hour or so later having had the op. I was wheeled to a recovery area and again gently carefully looked after. Coffee sandwich and care was great.... I can’t express my thanks enough for a smooth considerate and professional service. THANK YOU to all concerned from start to finish.

readBy.name: The Royal Bournemouth and Christchurch Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Kann86
title: I barely felt a thing
body: Attended today to have a dermal piercing removed that was lodged under my skin. Appointment was at 11. 40 & I got took right on 11. 40. I was cared for by kirsty & Laura. Procedure was explained to me & carried out quickly & I barely felt a thing. Aftercare was explained also. Could not fault the treatment I received.

author: Loz85
title: Community nurses
body:
I am under CNT2 community nursing, this morning I had my usual dressing visit. I then got a call a couple of hrs later from a very rude nurse, now this isn’t the first time this person has been very rude on the phone to me and my carers can confirm this, as this morning my carer was disgusted at what they were saying. I don’t want to go into my personal details on here but I am happy to talk with their manager re this as this needs to stop.  
I will be speaking to my care manager about this also.

author: Matt1982
title: Wisdom tooth extraction
body:
I had a broken wisdom tooth which needed to come out.  
I attended clinic 11 at uhcw, which from the outset was professional.  
I was met my Mr Stockton who went through the short procedure. There was a also a dental nurse+assistant (sorry forgotten your names) also who was very reassuring for such a nervous person.  
During the extraction, communication, professionalism and reassurance was far beyond what I was expecting.  
It wasn't pleasant, but feel delighted with the service I received.

author: QI-yadh
title: Request for mental help denied
body:
Back in 2018 I had a mental breakdown. I contacted my GP who agreed with me I needed urgent help. I was referred to this centre, but upon meeting the two specialists they refused to take notes or take my concerns seriously. I was very angry at the time and explained that I had difficulty controlling that anger, yet nothing was done to help me.  
I eventually walked out in frustration. A few weeks later I had a full amnesia period, resulting in an altercation involving the police, As I was not in a fit state of mind at the time nothing further came of it, but I do feel that if your staff had been more concerned with my wellbeing I would not have ended up in this position.

author: Resident of Rothiemurchus
title: Flu vaccination
body: Well done Aviemore Medical Practice. Flu vaccination clinic couldn’t have been better planned and organised.   Thank you   👏😁🙏

author: Doodleowner
title: Excellent care
body: Excellent care from staff whilst getting a ct angiogram in October 2020, thanks also to the staff in the ct dept and the porter

author: StevetheBird
title: Family Service
body:
We had counselling regarding some concerns that we have about some close family members and their possible substance abuse. We received a number of one to one counselling sessions through microsoft teams and a number of group sessions, also online.  
The counselling that we received was invaluable in helping us to support one family member who has made fantastic progress in stopping their substance abuse, which in turn has helped to spur them on to deal with other mental health issues, including increased self confidence and the wherewithal to move on to tackle their nicotine habit as well.  
In addition to this, the counselling was invaluable to us as a couple to help us to deal with our own thoughts and emotions as we have worked our way through the above difficult process. It has also given us the best tools to move forwards and tackle the concerns that we have with a second family member when the timing is appropriate.

title: Made to feel like family
body: Both practices are fabulous but I have more appointments at Concept House. From the reception staff to having a choice of doctors you are always made to feel that you are being looked after. The people there go out of their way to make sure you are helped and I always feel they go the extra mile if there is anything you need. They are responsive to the needs of their patients and work with them to get the best outcome. I often recommend the surgeries when I hear someone is looking for a new GP.

title: Really excellent service
body:
I was really pleased with the care and consideration I was given at my appointment on 14/10 /2020
Tish the health care assistant was really helpful to me as I am very poor on my mobility . Such a happy person ,as we're the rest of the staff
